subject: Re: [junit] LinkageError
msgSnippet: I struggled with this exact error forever.  What ended up being the problem for me is that I had two ways of implementing XML parsing.  Try adding the xalan
messageBody:
I struggled with this exact error forever. What ended
up being the problem for me is that I had two ways of
implementing XML parsing. Try adding the
xalan 2.4.1 jar into your ant/lib directory, you can
find it here:
http://www.ibiblio.org/maven/xalan/jars/xalan-2.4.1.jar.
Let me know if that works for you.

Best regards,
James Asher

--- chriskrn1 <chriskrn1@...> wrote:
> Hi
>
> I know this has appeared on the list before, but I
> am struggling to
> get it resolved. I am getting the ff exception when
> I run any ant
> junit task:
>
> BUILD FAILED
> java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated
> when linking
> org/w3c/dom/Document class
> at
>
org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.newDocumentBuilder(
> DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.java:88)
> at
>
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLJUnitResultFormatter.
> getDocumentBuilder(XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java:93)
> at
>
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLJUnitResultFormatter.
> startTestSuite(XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java:138)
> at
>
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.fireStar
> tTestSuite(JUnitTestRunner.java:433)
> at
>
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.run(JUni
> tTestRunner.java:279)
> at
>
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask.executeInVM(JU
> nitTask.java:804)
>
> .... etc
>
> My ant lib directory has the ff jars in it:
> ant.jar, junit.jar (v3.7), optional.jar,
> xercesImpl.jar and xml-
> apis.jar.
>
> I am running ant v1.5.
>
> I have edited the excluded.properties file in my
> junit.jar, and it
> now looks as follows:
>
> excluded.0=sun.*
> excluded.1=com.sun.*
> excluded.2=org.omg.*
> excluded.3=javax.*
> excluded.4=sunw.*
> excluded.5=java.*
> excluded.6=org.w3c.dom.*
> excluded.7=org.xml.sax.*
>
> However, I still get the same error. I have also
> tried junit3.8.1,
> with no luck.
>
> My ant task looks as follows:
>
> <target name="testdoowner" depends="env.is.set">
> <junit printsummary="withOutAndErr"
> haltonfailure="yes">
> <classpath refid="classpathtest"/>
> <formatter type="xml"/>
> <sysproperty key="test" value="testdoowner*"/>
> <sysproperty key="runtestsetup"
> value="${runtestsetup}"/>
> <sysproperty key="runlm" value="${runlm}"/>
> <sysproperty key="loadmodule"
> value="doowner"/>
> <sysproperty key="${security.auth.property}"
> value="${security.auth.property.value}"/>
> <test
> name="com.tebabank.bp.test.client.TestClient"
> haltonfailure="no"
> outfile="testdoowner"/>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> I have struggling with this now for two days, so any
> help in this
> regard would be highly appreciated.
>
> Regards
> Chris
>
>
>
